1.t: By the sun and its noon-time brightness,

2.t: by the moon when it follows the sun,

3.t: by the day when it brightens the earth,

4.t: by the night when it covers the earth with darkness,

5.t: by the heavens and that (Power) which established them,

6.t: by the earth and that (Power) which spread it out

7.t: and by the soul and that (Power) which designed it

8.t: and inspired it with knowledge of evil and piety,

9.t: those who purify their souls will certainly have everlasting happiness

10.t: and those who corrupt their souls will certainly be deprived (of happiness).

11.t: The people of Thamud rejected (the truth) as a result of their rebelliousness

12.t: when the most corrupt of them incited them (to commit evil).

13.t: The Messenger of God told them, "This is a she-camel, belonging to God. Do not deprive her of her share of water".
13.tr: Faqaala lahum Rasoolul laahi naaqatal laahi Wa-suqiyaahaa

14.t: However, they rejected him and slew her. So their Lord completely destroyed them and their city for their sins.
14.tr: Fakazzaboohu fa'aqaroohaa fadamdama 'alaihim Rabbuhum bizambihim fasaw-waahaa

15.t: God is not afraid of the result of what He had decreed.
